title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a cherished recipe passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious, nutty filling, this pie is perfect for holiday celebrations or any special occasion that calls for a sweet Southern treat.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the prepared pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. When baking, watch the pie closely after reducing the temperature to prevent overbrowning. Let the pie cool fully to achieve the perfect slice.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a timeless dessert that fills your kitchen with the warm aroma of toasted pecans and vanilla. Its golden, flaky crust cradles a rich, gooey filling studded with crunchy pecan halves, making every bite a delightful balance of textures and flavors.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern flavors that bring nostalgia and comfort
  • Perfect balance of sweet, nutty, and buttery notes
  • Ideal for holiday gatherings, family dinners, and special celebrations
  • Uses simple, pantry-friendly ingredients
  • Beautiful presentation with a glossy, golden finish

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion where my friend Joyce shared her treasured recipe. The moment I bit into its rich filling and crisp crust, I knew it was a keeper—every slice tells a story of Southern hospitality and tradition.

• Main ingredient: Pecans provide a buttery crunch and authentic Southern flavor; use fresh halves for the best texture.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds warmth and depth; choose pure vanilla for a richer taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs create a tender crust and smooth filling, while corn syrup gives the pie its signature glossy sweetness.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork for dough, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, and an oven thermometer for precise baking.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll dough into a 9-inch pie plate and layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake at 450°F for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 350°F and bake until golden and set, about 40-50 minutes.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack to allow filling to firm up before slicing. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature for best flavor and texture.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Chilling the dough is essential for a flaky crust.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling.
  • Look for a golden crust and a slightly jiggly center as doneness cues.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for longer freshness; reheat gently before serving.

structured_content.content: This pie always brings back fond memories of sharing sweet moments with loved ones during the holidays. Its rich flavor and inviting aroma make it a centerpiece that sparks conversation and joy at any table.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, complex twist. Toast pecans lightly before adding to deepen their flavor. For extra richness, swirl in a bit of melted dark chocolate before baking.

Serve slices with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of sweet dessert wine. This pie shines at festive dinners, potlucks, and cozy family gatherings.

For a gluten-free crust, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can use coconut oil instead of butter and flax eggs in place of eggs. Try adding chopped dried fruits or swapping pecans for walnuts or almonds for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use cold ingredients and minimal handling for a tender crust.
  • Toast pecans briefly to amplify their natural oils and flavor.
  • Start baking at high heat to set the crust, then lower to finish cooking the filling evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a shiny, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie II recipe in your repertoire, you can confidently create a dessert that delights both the eyes and palate. Enjoy the process and savor the sweet rewards of homemade Southern hospitality.
